title: How to Get Pee Stains and Smells Out of a Mattress

steps.title: Mix together hydrogen peroxide, baking soda, and dish detergent.
steps.content: Mix together hydrogen peroxide, baking soda, and dish detergent. In a small bowl, combine 8 fl oz (240 ml) of 3% hydrogen peroxide, 3 US tablespoons (43.2 g) of baking soda, and 2 drops of liquid dish soap. Then, use a spoon to mix the ingredients thoroughly. [1] X Research source Mix the ingredients in a spray bottle, if you prefer. Hydrogen peroxide is effective at disinfecting surfaces and lifting off stains. [2] X Trustworthy Source Cleveland Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source Note : Hydrogen peroxide can bleach fabrics. Apply a bit of it on a hidden part of the mattress to see if it bleaches the fabric before applying it all over. Use the solution immediately, as hydrogen peroxide breaks down fast. If you have a solution older than 1 to 2 hours, prepare a new one. This solution is also effective on blood stains.

steps.title: Dab the stain with the cleaner and let it sit for 15 minutes.
steps.content: Dab the stain with the cleaner and let it sit for 15 minutes. Lightly wet a white cleaning cloth with the hydrogen peroxide mixture. Then, repeatedly dab the stain to soak it with the solution. Allow the hydrogen peroxide to work through the stain for 15 to 20 minutes. [3] X Research source Alternatively, spray the stain with the mixture until the spot is damp. Do not completely saturate the mattress with the hydrogen peroxide solution, as this can cause it to take longer to dry. Put on a pair of cleaning gloves to protect your skin as you clean. Use a white cleaning cloth instead of a colorful one to prevent dye from transferring and staining your mattress.

steps.title: Blot the stain with a clean cloth and apply more cleaner, if needed.
steps.content: Blot the stain with a clean cloth and apply more cleaner, if needed. Use a clean white cloth to dab at the stain, which helps lift up the urine and remove excess moisture. If the stain is still visible, apply more of the hydrogen peroxide mixture, let it sit for 15 minutes, and dab at it again. [4] X Research source Keep repeating this step until the stain is completely gone.

steps.title: Sprinkle baking soda on top of the stain and let it sit for 8 hours.
steps.content: Sprinkle baking soda on top of the stain and let it sit for 8 hours. Baking soda is an excellent deodorizer that also helps soak up moisture. Just cover the stain with a thick layer of baking soda. Then, leave it to sit for at least 8 hours. [5] X Research source Note : Pet urine can be more difficult to clean. If your mattress still smells, spray the spot with an enzyme cleaner . This cleaner is specifically made to tackle urine stains and odors.

steps.title: Vacuum the mattress and let it air dry.
steps.content: Vacuum the mattress and let it air dry. Use a brush attachment or hand-held vacuum to remove the baking soda on the mattress. If the stained spot still isn’t dry, let your mattress air dry before putting on sheets and covers. Turn on an overhead fan, open your windows, or place fans on the mattress. [6] X Research source Wait to make the bed until it is completely dry. Putting on sheets and covers when the mattress is still damp can trap moisture and potentially lead to mold and bacteria growing.

steps.title: Strip the bed and wash the bedding in warm water.
steps.content: Strip the bed and wash the bedding in warm water. Take the covers, sheets, and pillowcases off your bed and throw them in your laundry machine. If you have a removable and washable mattress cover, put it in the wash, too. [7] X Research source Wash your bedding using the hottest water that’s safe for your sheets and covers. This helps remove germs and odors. Look at the care labels on your bedding to find out what water temperature and wash cycle is recommended for them. If your bedding is super smelly, get rid of the urine odor by adding 1 cup (240 ml) of white vinegar into the wash or by using an enzyme-based detergent .

steps.title: Blot up the excess urine with a white cloth.
steps.content: Blot up the excess urine with a white cloth . Get out a clean, dry cloth or paper towel and dab the stain to soak up as much of the urine as possible. Just keep blotting the spot until the mattress feels damp. [8] X Research source Do not rub or scrub the spot, as this can work the urine further into the mattress and make it more difficult to clean. Wear cleaning gloves to protect your skin from the urine. Change the cloth or paper towel when it gets saturated with liquid. Using a white cloth instead of a colorful one helps prevent your mattress from getting stained.

steps.title: Pour baking soda on the stain to soak up the remaining urine.
steps.content: Pour baking soda on the stain to soak up the remaining urine. Apply several spoonfuls of baking soda on top of the stain. Don’t worry about using too much, as it won't damage the mattress. The baking soda helps absorb the urine and cleaner while helping deodorize, too. [9] X Research source

steps.title: Fill a spray bottle with equal parts white vinegar and water.
steps.content: Fill a spray bottle with equal parts white vinegar and water. Pour the water and white vinegar directly into the spray bottle. The white vinegar helps to lift the stain, kill bacteria, and get rid of the urine odor. [10] X Research source For a stronger solution, reduce the amount of water or eliminate it altogether. It's okay to spray pure white vinegar onto the mattress. Add a few drops of laundry detergent or dish soap for an extra cleaning boost. While white vinegar has a strong smell, the scent dissipates as the vinegar dries.

steps.title: Spray the vinegar solution on the stain and let it sit for 5 minutes.
steps.content: Spray the vinegar solution on the stain and let it sit for 5 minutes. Apply enough of the vinegar mixture so the mattress is damp but not completely saturated. Then, leave it to soak into the urine stain for at least 5 minutes. [11] X Research source The baking soda might bubble and fizz when you spray on the vinegar. This is a natural reaction when baking soda and vinegar mix together. Make sure the entire stain is covered with the white vinegar. You may need to make more if there isn't enough to cover the whole stain. If you have some white vinegar solution leftover, leave it in the spray bottle to use another time.

steps.title: Blot the stain to remove the moisture and sprinkle baking soda on top.
steps.content: Blot the stain to remove the moisture and sprinkle baking soda on top. Dab the stain with a clean cloth to remove as much of the urine and solution as possible. Then, sprinkle on a thin layer of baking soda on top. This helps to soak up moisture and remove urine odors from the mattress. [12] X Research source

steps.title: Let the mattress dry for about 18 hours, then vacuum it.
steps.content: Let the mattress dry for about 18 hours, then vacuum it. Open all of the windows and doors in the room, turn on an overhead fan, or leave fans blowing on the mattress. If the mattress feels completely dry after about 18 hours, use a brush attachment or hand-held vacuum to clean up the baking soda. [13] X Research source If your mattress is still stained or still smells like urine after 18 hours, apply more vinegar solution and baking soda. Or, try the hydrogen peroxide method for dried stains. Do not make the bed until the mattress is dry. If the mattress doesn’t have enough time to dry, mold, mildew, and bacteria can grow. It might take slightly longer or shorter for the mattress to dry depending on the temperature and humidity.

steps.title: Sprinkle baking soda over the entire mattress.
steps.content: Sprinkle baking soda over the entire mattress. Baking soda absorbs smells, like urine, and neutralizes lingering odors. [14] X Research source Just strip your bed of the covers and sheets and then apply a thin layer of baking soda on top of the mattress. [15] X Research source

steps.title: Let the baking soda sit for 8 to 10 hours.
steps.content: Let the baking soda sit for 8 to 10 hours. It takes time for the baking soda to pull the urine smell out of your mattress. Just leave the baking soda on the mattress for at least 8 to 10 hours. [16] X Research source

steps.title: Vacuum off the baking soda.
steps.content: Vacuum off the baking soda. Grab a hand-held vacuum or use your floor vacuum’s brush attachment to sweep up the baking soda. If you still smell urine, apply more baking soda, let it sit, and then vacuum it off. [17] X Research source Tip : Cleaning your mattress regularly can help prevent smelly odors. About every 6 months, vacuum your mattress, sprinkle on baking soda, and then sweep it up. Washing your sheets about once a week can help prevent odors from forming, too.

steps.title: Spray your mattress with an enzyme cleaner if it still smells.
steps.content: Spray your mattress with an enzyme cleaner if it still smells. Urine smells, especially those caused by pets, can be stubborn and hard to remove. Enzyme cleaners are made specifically for protein-based stains, like urine, and can completely eliminate urine smells. Simply follow the manufacturer’s instructions for using the cleaner. [18] X Trustworthy Source American Kennel Club The American Kennel Club (AKC) is a purebred dog pedigree registry in the United States. The AKC advocates for the responsible ownership of dogs and promotes purebred dog events, such as the Westminster Dog Show. Go to source Using an enzyme cleaner typically involves spraying the stain, letting it sit for 1 hour, and then blotting it with a cloth.
